prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー（有資格）" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled:
The most accurate paraphrase of "ケアスタッフ（無資格）" from the options provided is C. 介護職（無資格）.

Explanation:

* A. 介護職 is not a correct paraphrase as it refers to caregivers in general, regardless of their qualifications.
* B. 介護職（有資格） is not a correct paraphrase as it specifically refers to caregivers with qualifications.
* D. 介護職／正社員 is not a correct paraphrase as it refers to the relationship between caregivers and full-time employees.
* E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト is not a correct paraphrase as it refers to the relationship between caregivers and part-time or casual workers.
* F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員 is not a correct paraphrase as it specifically refers to caregivers with qualifications who are employed as full-time employees.
* G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト is not a correct paraphrase as it specifically refers to caregivers with qualifications who are employed as part-time or casual workers.

Therefore, the most accurate paraphrase of "ケアスタッフ（無資格）" is C. 介護職（無資格）, which means "caregiver

The reference information does not mention whether a caregiver must have certain qualifications to work in the field, but it does mention that the term "介護職" does not necessarily imply that the person has those qualifications. Option C (Caregiver (without qualifications)) is also incorrect since the term "介護職" does not necessarily imply that the person is without qualifications.

Option D (Caregiver (without qualifications) / Part-time or Casual Worker), E (Caregiver (without qualifications) / Part-time or Casual Worker), and G (Caregiver (without qualifications) / Part-time or Casual Worker) are all incorrect since the person may be working as a full-time employee, not just a part-time or casual worker.

Option F (Caregiver (with qualifications) / Full-time Employee) is the most accurate paraphrase because it recognizes that a caregiver with qualifications could potentially be a full-time employee, not just a part-time or contract employee. Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

C. 介護職（無資格）

E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:
